basics.name: Robbie Reaves
basics.label: Technical Project Manager
basics.summary: Robbie is a project manager working at an e commerce company in northern california. he likes his job because it allows him to work with smart people on interesting projects. Right now he's working on prioritizing a jira backlog, but sometimes he goes to national parks. more often than not he's watching films and sometimes editing them.

work.summary: Build books about $1.2 million in revenue for each of its 500 employees. I work with a group of ~ 50 developers on a web application that serves our flagship site, as well as a host of other niche sites. We also support a full custom order management platform, a content publishing tool which can send json responses that look great on templates for any device, and a host of other small tools for managing the 800,000 or so products we sell. Recently we've on-boarded several new acquisitions onto our platform (including my favorite, kegerator.com)
highlights: I oversee multiple projects across all phases of development concerning a flagship site and 19 other niche sites running on a node/java application. Marketing beacons, custom 3rd party integrations, reviews, article content, templates and landing pages.
Overseeing long and brutal platform migration from 13 year old legacy coldfusion codebase to a more modern node platform
Work as part of an interdisciplinary team to improve search relevancy and product recommendations.
Help to build shared consensus and foster decision-making across projects.
Collaborating with product managers to gather requirements,  manage expectations, and make better mistakes tomorrow .

references.name: Trusted Coworker
references.reference: It is my pleasure to recommend Robbie, his performance working as a project manager for Build.com proved that he will be a valuable addition to any company.
